item.title: [Mini remake] NetBeans anagram game
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

well sonny bill 9, you haven’t clearly written what your question is, i had to read your post a few times to get some idea of what you’re asking
try this format

Hello, my name is , I was doing some stuff with java

I have this bug where instead of happening, happens instead

this is my code so far

<code>

its very important that you explain your problem, so people don’t to run your code to see, because some people might be at work where they cant run any programs.
Think of this way, the code you post is for looking at, not for running.

^^ so now edit your first post, use paragraphs instead of one whole block of text

for one part of your question, it seems you want us to find loads of anagrams for you, no-one is going to do that here, you don’t need any java knowledge to find an anagram, a 6 year old can do that.

you ask for another way to hold your strings,

    public String A = "hello";
    public String B = "green";

thats what you do now, i suggest you use the interface Set and a good implementation of it like HashSet

in your code, put something like

Set<String> anagrams = new HashSet<String>();

then when you want to add strings, do

anagrams.add("hello");
anagrams.add("green");
anagrams.add("goodbye");

and if you want to check the set has it, do something like this

if(anagrams.contains("MyAnagram")) {
    //rest of code
}

Read full topic

item.title: [Mini remake] NetBeans anagram game
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

private final static String newline = "\n"; public String A = "hello"; public String B = "green"; public int X = 0;

String Text = Edit1.getText(); if (X == 0) { if (Text.equals(A)) { Edit1.setText("CORRECT!! next word..."); X = X + 1; Textarea1.setText(""); } else { Textarea1.append(newline + Text + " is incorrect" + newline); Edit1.selectAll(); } } if (X == 1) { Textarea1.setText("regen" + newline); if (Text.equals(B)) { Edit1.setText("CORRECT!! next word..."); } else { Textarea1.append(Text + " is incorrect" + newline); } Edit1.selectAll(); } }

setTitle("Mini anagram game"); Textarea1.append("elhol");

Sorry but thats not really helping.

item.title: [Mini remake] NetBeans anagram game
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

Hey, i am continuing my unfinished quest to learn java, seeing the netbeans anagram game gave me an idea to make my own one, seeing that they use a word library and i dont know how to do that i just have 2 words, hello and green. I was wondering if someone could help me get a different way to do this and maybe help me with a little bug. By that i mean help me add more words, the bug is that when you get the first “hello” word coorect it puts in the new word but also “hello” is incorrect this is the source, btw im pretty sure it has “hello” left in the box and also checks that for green, run it and see what i mean.

[code]/*

  • NewJFrame3.java
  • Created on December 14, 2007, 10:07 PM
    */
    package javaapplication6;

/**
*

  • @author Jason
    */
    public class NewJFrame3 extends javax.swing.JFrame {

    private final static String newline = “\n”;
    public String A = “hello”;
    public String B = “green”;
    public int X = 0;

    /** Creates new form NewJFrame3 */
    public NewJFrame3() {
    setTitle(“Mini anagram game”);
    initComponents();
    Textarea1.append(“elhol”);
    }

    /** This method is called from within the constructor to

    • initialize the form.

    • WARNING: Do NOT modify this code. The content of this method is

    • always regenerated by the Form Editor.
      */
      //
      private void initComponents() {

      Edit1 = new javax.swing.JTextField();
      jScrollPane1 = new javax.swing.JScrollPane();
      Textarea1 = new javax.swing.JTextArea();

      setDefaultCloseOperation(javax.swing.WindowConstants.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);

      Edit1.addActionListener(new java.awt.event.ActionListener() {
      public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
      Edit1ActionPerformed(evt);
      }
      });

      Textarea1.setColumns(20);
      Textarea1.setRows(5);
      jScrollPane1.setViewportView(Textarea1);

      javax.swing.GroupLayout layout = new javax.swing.GroupLayout(getContentPane());
      getContentPane().setLayout(layout);
      layout.setHorizontalGroup(
      layout.createParallelGroup(javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING)
      .addComponent(Edit1, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, 228, Short.MAX_VALUE)
      .addComponent(jScrollPane1, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, 228, Short.MAX_VALUE)
      );
      layout.setVerticalGroup(
      layout.createParallelGroup(javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING)
      .addGroup(layout.createSequentialGroup()
      .addComponent(Edit1, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, javax.swing.GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
      .addPreferredGap(javax.swing.LayoutStyle.ComponentPlacement.RELATED)
      .addComponent(jScrollPane1, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 139, javax.swing.GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
      .addContainerGap())
      );

      pack();
      }//
      private void Edit1ActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
      String Text = Edit1.getText();
      if (X == 0) {
      if (Text.equals(A)) {
      Edit1.setText(“CORRECT!! next word…”);
      X = X + 1;
      Textarea1.setText("");
      } else {
      Textarea1.append(newline + Text + " is incorrect" + newline);
      Edit1.selectAll();
      }
      }
      if (X == 1) {
      Textarea1.setText(“regen” + newline);
      if (Text.equals(B)) {
      Edit1.setText(“CORRECT!! next word…”);
      } else {
      Textarea1.append(Text + " is incorrect" + newline);
      }
      Edit1.selectAll();
      }
      }

    /**

    • @param args the command line arguments
      */
      public static void main(String args[]) {
      java.awt.EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {

       public void run() {
     new NewJFrame3().setVisible(true);
 }

      });
      }
      // Variables declaration - do not modify
      private javax.swing.JTextField Edit1;
      private javax.swing.JTextArea Textarea1;
      private javax.swing.JScrollPane jScrollPane1;
      // End of variables declaration
      }
      [/code]
      Thanks.
